intro: Sagenia subpedata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sagena, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in composite inflorescences. Sagenia subpedata is typically found in open, sandy or rocky habitats. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
